column1: Belfalas was a region of southern Gondor
column2: encompassing the coast from the mouth of the Anduin to Dol Amroth.

column1: Belfalas formed a part of Dor-en-Ernil
column2: or the "Princes land". The Prince in question here was the Lord of Dol Amroth
column3: who lived at the city bearing his name.

column1: At the start of the second millennium of the Third Age
column2: a certain Imrazôr the Númenor lived in and ruled over the Belfalas. He married Mithrellas
column4: and their son Galador became the first Prince of Dol Amroth.

column1: The Belfalas was also home to an old Elf haven named Edhellond. Its chief city was the Princes residence of Dol Amroth.
South of the Belfalas lay a great Bay
column2: which was named after it the Bay of Belfalas.

column1: During the War of the Ring
column2: the Belfalas was raided by the Corsairs of Umbar
column3: and therefore did not send any men to help defend Minas Tirith
column4: until Aragorn liberated the coast with the Grey Company
column5: freeing Gondors southern armies to follow him north to relieve Minas Tirith.

column1: The name Belfalas consists of bel (a Pre-Númenórean element of unknown meaning) + Sindarin falas ("shore").
